channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Joey Barton gets suspended prison sentence for offensive social media posts
item.description: Ex-footballer was convicted last month over posts targeting pundits Lucy Ward and Eni Aluko, and broadcaster Jeremy Vine Former footballer Joey Barton...

item.title: Ukraine war live: Zelenskyy to meet Starmer, Macron and Merz in London over peace push
item.description: Ukrainian president’s discussions with leaders of UK, France and Germany come after US-Ukraine talks in Florida failed to achieve breakthrough See all...

item.title: Weather tracker: Atmospheric rivers to bring heavy rain and snow to Pacific north-west
item.description: Flood and weather alerts in place across western half of region as parts of Iraq and Iran also face significant rain Weather alerts are in effect acro...

item.title: Zelenskyy to meet European leaders in London for talks on ending Ukraine war
item.description: Ukraine president’s UK visit comes amid heavy pressure from Washington for Kyiv to cede territory to Moscow Russia-Ukraine war – latest news updates V...

item.title: Washington DC police chief Pamela Smith to step down, mayor announces – US politics live
item.description: Move follows deployment of national guard in city Here is Bowser’s full statement on Smith stepping down: When Chief Smith stepped up to lead the Metr...

item.title: Salah involved in Liverpool training after outburst
item.description: Mohamed Salah takes part in Liverpool's training session on Monday following his explosive interview at the weekend.

item.title: Thousands flee Thai-Cambodia border after deadly clashes
item.description: At least five people have been killed in the most serious confrontation between both sides since July.

item.title: DJ Tim Westwood pleads not guilty to rape and assault
item.description: The former BBC Radio 1 and Capital Xtra presenter denies 15 charges at a court hearing in London.

item.title: One hundred abducted schoolchildren released in Nigeria
item.description: Details of the release of the schoolchildren are still unclear and 165 people remain unaccounted for.

item.title: 50,000 new apprenticeships promised in youth employment push
item.description: Funding will be used to help employ young people in sectors including AI, hospitality and engineering.
